doc:
Judy Holliday https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Judy_Holliday 0 Judy Holliday (born Judith Tuvim, June 21, 1921 – June 7, 1965) was an American actress, comedian, and singer.She began her career as part of a nightclub act before working in Broadway plays and musicals. Her success in the 1946 stage production of Born Yesterday as Billie Dawn led to her being cast in the 1950 film version for which she won an Academy Award for Best Actress and a Golden Globe Award for Best Actress – Motion Picture Musical or Comedy. She appeared in several films during the 1950s. She was known for her performance on Broadway in the musical Bells Are Ringing, winning a Tony Award for Best Performance by a Leading Actress in a Musical and reprising her role in the 1960 film. In 1952, Holliday was called to testify before the Senate Internal Security Subcommittee to answer claims she was associated with communism. She appeared in several_films during the_1950s . She was_known for her_performance on Broadway in the_musical_Bells Are Ringing , winning a_Tony_Award for Best Performance by a_Leading_Actress in a_Musical and reprising her_role in the_1960_film . In 1952 , Holliday was_called to_testify before the_Senate_Internal_Security_Subcommittee to_answer claims she was_associated with communism .
